title: [BUG] Unable to load library 'libSkiaSharp.dll' when SkiaSharp used on a UserControl / Control (Designer)
body:
**Description**

I made a sample solution to explain the problem, composed by two projects:
-Windows Form Net App (build target x64)
-UserControl library referenced to the windows form net app (build target Any CPU) that use SkiaSharp library 2.80.3 imported from nuget.

In the UserControl class there is only a simple/random instantiation of a SkiaSharp class (SKPaint in this case) that cause the main problem:
"Unable to load library 'libSkiaSharp' ..."

I noticed that the file libSkiaSharp.dll it can be found on the bin\debug folder inside the respective target folder (x86, x64), but not on the main bin\debug directory; so i tried to copy it there too, but haven't resolved the problem.

**Expected Behavior**

Creation of the user control and correct localisation of the libSkiaSharp.dll

**Actual Behavior**

Can't create the user control and unable to locate the libSkiaSharp.dll.
After this error, visual studio crashes and after reopen the solution i noticed that in the references is added the file 
"\skiasharp\2.80.3\runtimes\osx\native\libSkiaSharp.dylib"

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.80.3
- Last known good version:  2.80.3 (?)
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2019 / 2022 (tried both)
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Windows Classic:  Windows 10 (.net 4.7.2, tried both x86 and x64)

**Screenshots**

![skiasharp error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66755712/160802419-99a75e8a-9517-4aef-813d-450540741602.png)
